allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Phase 2 Editorial: Remove all v2.2 transition content

Editorial revision to present v2.2 as definitive framework:

- Remove all "What 's New in v2.2" sections from publications
- Remove v2.1 vs v2.2 comparison tables
- Remove annotations: (NEW), (v2.2), (upgraded from...), [NEW in v2.2]
- Rename v22-suffixed functions to clean names (S6)
- Update PROVEN count to 13 (including det(g) = 65/32)
- Archive removed content in CHANGELOG_v2.2_removed_content.md

Files revised: gift_2_2_main.md, S1-S9 supplements,
Observable_Reference, Geometric_Justifications, Statistical_Validation

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
docs(v2.2): Implement conceptual consolidation plan

Execute complete conceptual consolidation plan for GIFT v2.2:

Task 1: Input/Output Clarification Tables
- Add Section 1.4 "Structural Assumptions and Derived Quantities" to main paper
- Add "Framework Logic" section to summary.txt
- Add Section 0 "Framework Logic Summary" to Observable Reference

Task 2: Zero-Parameter Reformulation
- Create GLOSSARY.md with precise terminology definitions
- Update abstract to clarify "no continuous adjustable parameters"
- Add clarification to Section 14.1 conclusion
- Rename S1 Section 3.7 to "Structural Determination Without Continuous Parameters"

Task 3: Three-Layer Hierarchy
- Add Section 1.5 "Result Hierarchy" with Layer 1/2/3 classification
- Add disclaimer note to Section 10 "Structural Patterns" in Geometric Justifications
- Add Section 5 "Number-Theoretic Patterns: Status and Interpretation" to S9

Task 4: Reading Guide
- Create READING_GUIDE.md with time-based and interest-based navigation
- Add "How to Read This Framework" table to summary.txt
- Create README.md for publications folder

Task 5: Terminology Consistency
- Standardize "zero continuous adjustable parameters" terminology
- Update S7_phenomenology.md for consistency

Files modified: 7
Files created: 3 (GLOSSARY.md, READING_GUIDE.md, README.md)

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(meta-hodge): Add K7 moduli space exploration and ML scout

Complete meta-hodge pipeline for K7_GIFT stability analysis:

Core exploration:
- deformation_explorer.py: Deformation parameter exploration (sigma, s, alpha)
- 7x7x7 grid exploration finding 31/343 stable points (9%)
- Diagonal band constraint: u ~ 1 - 1.13|alpha| (R^2=0.943)

ML boundary analysis:
- ml_boundary_classifier.py: SVM, Gaussian Process, quadratic fits
- Quadratic refinement achieving R^2=0.995
- Active learning suggestions for sampling

Autonomous scout:
- scout_moduli_space.py: ML-driven exploration for new stable regions
- 150-probe campaign finding 22 stable points (14.7%)
- 3 anomalies at extreme alpha discovered
- Extended bounds: alpha to +-0.50, v (sigma/s) from 0.28 to 3.00

Documentation:
- K7_DEFORMATION_ATLAS.md: Complete stability valley documentation (v1.6)
- K7_LANDSCAPE_POSITION.md: G2 manifold landscape context
- K7_VALLEY_UNIVERSALS.md: Universal properties analysis
- K7_GIFT_ATLAS.md: Overview atlas

Analysis notebooks:
- K7_Complete_Analysis_v1_0.ipynb
- K7_Yukawa_Analysis_v1_0.ipynb
- K7_G2_Validation_v1_0.ipynb

Key findings:
- Stability valley is a RIDGE (diagonal band), not a basin
- 3-family structure preserved across entire stable region
- Perfect sigma<->s symmetry for Yukawa values
- New stable vein at extreme alpha (-0.50) with low u (~0.50)

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(meta-hodge): Add Yukawa spectral analysis for 43/77 emergence

Spectral analysis to test if 43/77 visible/hidden split emerges
naturally from Yukawa tensor eigenspectrum:

Key findings from v1.8 analysis:
- det(g) = 2.03125 EXACT (65/32 target achieved)
- kappa_T = 0.0163 (0.59% error)
- Gap at position 42->43 is 2nd largest (3-4x mean)
- 43 non-zero eigenvalues in Yukawa Gram matrix

Conclusion:
- 43/77 split CAN emerge from spectral structure
- tau = 3472/891 requires true Yukawa (not proxy)
- Need H2 forms + full H3 for proper verification

Files added:
- analyze_yukawa_spectrum.py: Main analysis script
- YUKAWA_SPECTRAL_REPORT.md: Detailed findings
- Various Yukawa artifacts (.npz, .pt)

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
